Name: Turbocharged
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Builders gain one extra Build Charge

Name: Art of Violence
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Killing a unit provides Culture equal to 50% of its Combat Strength

Name: Emperor's Masterpiece
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Can spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the Production cost for Ancient and Classical wonders.

Name: Rivers of Stone
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Unlocks Canals with Masonry instead of Steam Power.

Name: I See You
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 level of Diplomatic Visibility with every encountered civilization.

Name: Double Oh Network
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: All Spies start with a free promotion.

Name: Developing a Bond
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Receives a free Spy (and extra Spy capacity) with Castles.

Name: Meiji Restoration
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Districts receive a +1 adjacency bonus for each adjacent district, instead of +0.5.

Name: Embezzlement
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Trade Routes generate +1 additional Gold from any of your Trading Posts they pass through.

Name: Road Network
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Founded or conquered cities start with a Trading Post and, if within Trade Route range of the Capital, a road to it.

Name: I Bless The Rainforests
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Choose one: Rainforests provide a +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, or Theater Square districts

Name: Tree Huggers
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Rainforests provide +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles, instead of the usual -1.

Name: Brain Wave
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Eurekas provide an extra 10% of the Science cost for researching technologies

Name: Inspired
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Inspirations provide an extra 10% of the Culture cost for researching civics

Name: Brave Voyagers
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Your units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles with Shipbuilding, instead of Cartography

Name: Amphibian
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Your units pay no additional Movement costs to embark or disembark

Name: Siren's Call
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Naval melee units can heal in neutral territory.

Name: Running Shoes
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Movement for all units.

Name: Enthusiastic
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Promoting a unit does not end that unit's turn.

Name: Nature Worship
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Improved resource tiles receive +1 Faith for each copy of the resource the city owns.

Name: Museumism
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Can purchase Archaeologists and Archaeological Museums with Faith.

Name: Horsin' Around
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Building a light cavalry unit grants a free second copy of that unit.

Name: Casus Belli
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: You cannot declare Surprise Wars or war on city-states. Surprise Wars cannot be declared on you.

Name: Fat Loot!
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Capturing a Barbarian Outpost also grants a Tribal Village reward.

Name: Levy-tatin'
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Levying city-state units costs 50% less Gold.

Name: Who Needs Diplomacy?
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: All Diplomatic policy slots in the current government are converted to Wildcard slots.

Name: Do Yourself A Favor
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Diplomatic Favor per turn for each Wildcard slot in the current government.

Name: Mine All Mine
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Mines gain +1 Culture and trigger a Culture Bomb when built.

Name: Age of Empires
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Dedications chosen at the beginning of a Golden Age or Heroic Age also grant their Normal Age bonuses towards improving Era Score, in addition to their regular bonuses.

Name: Hostile Annexation
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Building an Encampment triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.

Name: Flexible Leadership
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: One Military policy slot in all governments is converted into a Wildcard policy slot.

Name: Siege Workshop
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +30% Production toward Siege units.

Name: Death From Above
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Siege units gain +5 Combat Strength when attacking defensible districts.

Name: No Collateral
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Conquering a city doesn't cause that city to lose Population.

Name: Extending the Buoy-ders
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Building a Harbor triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.

Name: River Bank
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Choose one: Rivers provide a +2 adjacency bonus for Campus, Theater Square, or Industrial Zone districts.

Name: Stealing Knowledge
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Conquering a city grants a free Eureka for each Campus district in the conquered city

Name: Blatant Plagiarism
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Conquering a city grants a free Inspiration for each Theater Square district in the conquered city

Name: Free Imperial Cities
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Each city can build one more specialty District than the Population limit would normally allow.

Name: Hydrology
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Choose one: Coast and Lake tiles provide a +0.5 adjacency bonus for Holy Site, Campus, Industrial Zone, or Theater Square districts.

Name: Beach Party
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Entertainment Complexes built adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile provide +1 Amenity.

Name: Warehouses
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Harbor buildings grant +10 Strategic Resource stockpiles.

Name: Royal School of Engineering
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +100% Production towards Military Engineers. Military Engineers receive +2 charges.

Name: Overclocking
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Buildings that provide additional yields when powered receive +4 of their respective yields.

Name: Pit Workers
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Iron and Coal Mines accumulate +2 resources per turn

Name: Seine Post to Success
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +15% Production towards districts and wonders built next to a River.

Name: Flood Insurance
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Districts, improvements and units are immune to damage from floods.

Name: Engineered Irrigation
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Farms receive +2 Food when adjacent to an Aqueduct

Name: Sacred Soil
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Farms receive +1 Faith when adjacent to a Holy Site.

Name: Water Diviner
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Cities with an Aqueduct receive +1 Amenity, and +1 Faith for every Population.

Name: Sea View
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +3 Housing in coastal cities.

Name: Pasturised
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Building a Pasture triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.

Name: You Beauty!
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Choose one: Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, or Theater Square districts gain +1 to their yields in tiles with Charming Appeal, and +3 in tiles with Breathtaking Appeal.

Name: Prophet Margin
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Automatically receives the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (unless one has already been earned through other means).

Name: Blessed Scripture
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Science per foreign city following your Religion.

Name: Legend of the Five Suns
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Can spend Builder charges to complete 20% of a district's Production cost.

Name: Sand Castles
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: City Centers receive +1 Faith and +1 Food for every adjacent Desert and Desert Hills tile.

Name: Prospector
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Mines receive -1 Production and +4 Gold.

Name: Faith in the Economy
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: May purchase Commercial Hub buildings with Faith.

Name: Wide Net
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Food from Fishing Boats. Building a Fishing Boat triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.

Name: Wood Stock
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Unimproved Woods and Rainforests grant +1 Production, increasing to +2 Production with Mercantilism and +3 Production with Conservation.

Name: On The Waves
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Starts with Sailing and Shipbuilding unlocked and the ability to enter Ocean tiles.

Name: The Chief's Influence
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Cities with an established Governor gain +5% Culture, +5% Production, and +10% combat experience towards all units trained in the city

Name: Iron Fist
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: All cities within 9 tiles of a city with your Governor gain +4 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization.

Name: Debauchery
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Cities gain +1 Amenity for each Luxury Resource adjacent to the City Center.

Name: Met the Spectator!
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Starts with the Eureka for Writing.

Name: Coast Hunter
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Coastal cities founded by you and in the same continent as your Capital always have full Loyalty.

Name: Island Hopping
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Settlers receive +2 Movement and Sight while embarked, and pay no Movement costs to embark or disembark.

Name: Well Connected
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Sending a Trade Route immediately creates a Trading Post in the destination city, instead of when the Trade Route is completed. Gains an extra level of Diplomatic Visibility with civilizations that have a Trading Post from your Civilization.

Name: Greedy
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Founded cities start with five additional tiles.

Name: Snow Day
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Tundra tiles provide +1 Faith and +1 Production, in addition to their usual yields.

Name: Art Beat
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% Great Artist points gained from all sources.

Name: The Apprentice
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% Great Merchant points gained from all sources.

Name: Please Don't Stop The Music
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% Great Musician points gained from all sources.

Name: Stylish Leader
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: The Palace has four extra slots for Great Works.

Name: Leader in Industry
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Great Engineer points from Factories

Name: Leader in Research
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Great Scientist points from Universities.

Name: Pearl of the Danube
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% Production for districts and buildings built across a river from a City Center.

Name: Plato's Republic
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains an additional Wildcard policy slot in all Governments.

Name: Merchant Vessels
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Traders have +50% range over water, and can embark as soon as they are unlocked.

Name: Shrewd Negotiator
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% increase to all yields from International Trade Routes

Name: Who Needs Neighbours?
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Domestic Trade Routes provide +2 Gold and +1 Culture.

Name: Bow Selector
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +30% Production toward Ranged units.

Name: Mine Crafts
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Production for Mines over strategic resources, and +2 Gold for Mines over bonus and luxury resources.

Name: Armada
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: May form Fleets and Armadas with Mercantilism, instead of Nationalism and Mobilization.

Name: Colonies
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Cities not on your original Capital's continent receive 25% extra Production towards Districts and a Builder when founded.

Name: Photo Opportunity
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Double Tourism from Wonders of any Era.

Name: The Wonder Years
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +20% Production towards Medieval, Renaissance and Industrial Era Wonders.

Name: Onslaught
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Capturing a city will upgrade the conquering unit into a Corps or Army if the necessary civics are unlocked.

Name: Together Stronger
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Melee, ranged and anti-cavalry units receive +2 Combat Strength for each adjacent military unit.

Name: A Culture of Violence
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Receives Culture equal to 20% of the Production cost after training a non-civilian unit.

Name: Drive Out The Aggressors
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: All units gain +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Rainforest, Marsh, and Woods tiles, and +1 Movement if they start their turn there. Both of these bonuses are doubled in tiles inside your territory.

Name: Why Woodn't I?
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Can plant Woods with Medieval Faires, instead of Conservation.

Name: Tagmatic
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gain the Tagma unique unit with Divine Right.

Name: Hetairoi Cream
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gain the Hetairoi unique unit with Horseback Riding.

Name: Martial Law
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit.

Name: Surprise!
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +2 Movement for all units for the next 10 turns after declaring a Surprise War

Name: Oppressor
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +7 Combat Strength for all units when fighting city-states and their units.

Name: War Games
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains an additional Military policy slot in all Governments.

Name: Horses for Courses
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Cavalry class units have a chance to capture defeated cavalry class enemy units.

Name: Popularity Contest
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Enemies receive double war weariness from fighting against you.

Name: Poseidon
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: May purchase naval units with Faith.

Name: Viking Raid
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains the Viking Longship unique unit with Sailing. All naval melee units gain the ability to perform Coastal Raids. Receive Science in addition to Gold when pillaging and coastal raiding Mines and Culture in addition to Faith when pillaging and coastal raiding Quarries, Pastures, Plantations, and Camps.

Name: Shipbuilders
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +50% Production toward naval melee units.

Name: Coast Guard
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +5 Combat Strength for land units and naval units fighting on coastal and shallow water tiles

Name: Battle Ready
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Encampment districts are built in half the time.

Name: Holy Grail
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Relics grant +4 Gold, +2 Culture and +2 Faith.

Name: Holy River
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Holy Sites receive a +2 adjacency bonus from Rivers and grant 2 Housing if built next to a River

Name: I Can See Clearly Now
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +1 Sight for all units.

Name: Theme Scheme
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Buildings with at least three Great Work slots and wonders with at least two Great Work slots are automatically themed when all slots are filled.

Name: Economic Growth
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains an additional Economic policy slot in all Governments.

Name: Turtle
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +5 Combat Strength for all of your units within six tiles of your Capital.

Name: Helping Hand
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Non-capital cities within 6 tiles of your capital receive a Builder when founded.

Name: Black Army
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains the Black Army unique unit with Castles.

Name: Hill Start
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +4 Combat Strength for all of your units when fighting on hills.

Name: Magnanimous
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Recruiting or patronizing a Great Person refunds 20% of their point cost.

Name: Worshipping Costs
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: The Worship building for your Religion is 90% cheaper to purchase with Faith.

Name: Campaña Admirable
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Entering a new era grants a Comandante General, a unique type of Great Person

Name: Pargali Ibrahim
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Has access to a unique Governor, Ibrahim, the Grand Vizier.

Name: New Soldier
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains the Janissary unique unit with Gunpowder.

Name: Cowboy
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Gains the Rough Rider unique unit with Ballistics.

Name: Kick 'Em When They're Down
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: +5 Combat Strength for all units when attacking wounded units.

Name: Less Attitude, More Altitude
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Citizens can work Mountain tiles.

Name: Always Work, Don't Everest
Description: Add the following trait to your Civ card: Citizens can work Mountain tiles. Mountain tiles provide +2 Production, increasing to +3 Production after reaching the Industrial Era.
